alert.note: Alert for Lower St. Martin; St. Mary (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 5:43PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central St. Mary and southeastern St. Martin Parishes through 615 PM CDT... At 542 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Stephensville to near Burns Point. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morgan City, Patterson, Berwick, Stephensville, Burns Point, Bayou Vista, Ellerslie, Amelia, Patterson Memorial Airport and Bayou Geneve. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for south central Louisiana.
